page.title: 08LANGFORD HEATHFIELD
page.content: Langford Heathfield covers 178 acres. Oak and Ash are the main trees on it. Birch and willow trees grow as well, elm and gorse are less common.A road and a river run through it.The common is a home for Fallow Deer.Foxes, badgers and rabbits are common.Snakes are also found.Warblers are the most common bird,buzzards and nightingales are rare as is the greater spotted woodpecker.There are some wild flowers the Meadow Thistle and Sneezewort also pretty whin and heath violet.There are thirty species of butterfly .The heath used to be common land.It was bought with donated money.Many organisations donated money such as the NCC,WWF and the RSPB .Some people have a right to farm the land,others can cut down trees.
